node.title: Belfast collective wins prestigious Turner Prize with recreation of illegal pub
node.alt: A woman sits in a recreated Irish pub.
node.description: An 11-person Belfast collective aiming to transcend Northern Ireland's political and religious divides wins the $46,750 Turner Prize with a recreation of a traditional Irish illicit pub.
node.content:
["An 11-person collective from Belfast that aims to transcend Northern Ireland's political and religious divides has won the UK's prestigious Turner Prize for visual art.", "The Array Collective took the 25,000 pound ($46,750) prize for The Druithaib's Ball (druid's ball),\u00a0a recreation of a traditional Irish shebeen, an unlicensed pub, that is full of references to 100 years of Northern Ireland history.", "The installation included a floating roof made from protest and demonstration banners and an entrance of flag poles referencing ancient Irish ceremonial sites and contemporary structures.", "The collective, which addresses issues including abortion, gay rights, mental health, gentrification and social welfare,\u00a0described it as \"a place to gather outside the sectarian divides\".", "Tate Britain director and chair of the judging panel, Alex Farquharson, acknowledged the \"difficult, divided sectarian context\" the collective\u00a0worked in.", "\"They deal with very important issues but bring a sense of humour, pleasure, joy, hope and hospitality \u2014 often through absurdism, camp, theatre, to an otherwise very tense situation,\" he said.", "\"They bring a sense of release and a post-sectarian way of thinking.\"", "Collective member Laura O'Connor said the group would put the prize money towards finding a permanent base in Belfast, where redevelopment was making space less affordable for artists.", "Named after 19th-century landscape painter Joseph Mallard William\u00a0Turner, the award was founded in 1984 and helped make stars of potter Grayson Perry, shark-pickling artist Damien Hirst and filmmaker Steve McQueen.", "", "
In the 1990s, Hirst made a series of installations with animals preserved in formaldehyde in glass boxes.(Reuters: Dylan Martinez)
", "But it has also been criticised for rewarding impenetrable conceptual work and it often sparks debate about the value of modern art.", "In 2019, all four finalists were declared winners after they refused to compete against one another. Last year's prize was cancelled because of the coronavirus pandemic.", "This year, all five finalists were collectives rather than individual artists, all with an emphasis on social engagement.", "ABC/AP"]
